CatDescriptText: Rolland Ridley, 5634 Kirkwood Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 28, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "In your opinion, do you think that policemen have a 'free hand' to arrest ALL violators of the law, in 'policing' of their respective beats?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that the policeman has a free hand. If he believes that a person is wrong he has the opportunity to arrest him."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rolland Ridley wearing button down collared over shirt and dark hat, standing in front of building corner, right store window displaying picture of Asian girl, brick building with signs inscribed "...liquor" and "bob...shoe store" in background
